pull.title: test: fix RPC coverage check
pull.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/27593

Currently, the RPC coverage check in functional tests doesn't include a list of all RPCs. This fix enables wallet RPCs to be included in the `rpc_interface.txt` used in the coverage check

This PR Reverses part of the changes on PR https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16042 - Commit https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16042/commits/fa473303972b7dad600d949dc9b303d8136cb7e7#diff-4a04bc0b355c780033960e8c261ee9b6d3c452897e1dcd88a15d272512266c76R486 to speed up cache_creation by disabling the wallet

issue.title: test: RPC coverage check doesn't work?
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

Currently CI reports that all RPCs are covered: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6244871116161024?logs=ci#L4674

### Expected behaviour

However, some RPCs are clearly not covered because they are never called. For example:

```
$ git grep abortrescan  ./test/  | grep -v '. Please call `abortrescan` before ' | wc -l 
0
```

### Steps to reproduce

?

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Compiled from source

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

current master

### Operating system and version

any

### Machine specifications

_No response_

events.body: Also, it doesn't seem to work, because the CI should fail, because the `abortrescan` rpc is uncovered

@maflcko this is because [`self.options.descriptors`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/4de84557d6d1f53255ab19f27c8b6ea0a712934a/test/functional/test_framework/test_node.py#L111-L112) == None in `TestNode(... , descriptors=self.options.descriptors, ...)` hence the `disable_wallet` flag is added when the TestNode is instantiated disabling the wallet RPCs just before the first [`start_node()`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/4de84557d6d1f53255ab19f27c8b6ea0a712934a/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py#L827) is invoked

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/4de84557d6d1f53255ab19f27c8b6ea0a712934a/test/functional/test_framework/test_node.py#L111-L112

@BrandonOdiwuor There is a CI [error](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29387/checks?check_run_id=21316696148):
```
Uncovered RPC commands:
  - abortrescan
```
@jo-elimu that's the error the fix was to catch. Check the issue
In any case, a pull request with a failing CI can not be merged. Someone will need to add coverage for the RPC, here, or in a different pull.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -814,7 +814,7 @@ def _initialize_chain(self):
                     cache_node_dir,
                     chain=self.chain,
                     extra_conf=["bind=127.0.0.1"],
-                    extra_args=['-disablewallet'],
+                    extra_args=[],
comments.body: You can remove this? Also, it would be good to mention the commit that this reverts. (It may be one of mine)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -814,7 +814,7 @@ def _initialize_chain(self):
                     cache_node_dir,
                     chain=self.chain,
                     extra_conf=["bind=127.0.0.1"],
-                    extra_args=['-disablewallet'],
+                    extra_args=[],
comments.body:
The previous commit per git blame is [test: Speed up cache creation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/fa473303972b7dad600d949dc9b303d8136cb7e7#diff-4a04bc0b355c780033960e8c261ee9b6d3c452897e1dcd88a15d272512266c76R486) dated May 17, 2019 by @maflcko.

`-disablewallet` arg was added earlier in [qa: Premine to deterministic address with -disablewallet](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/faa669cbcd1fc799517b523b0f850e01b11bf40a#diff-4a04bc0b355c780033960e8c261ee9b6d3c452897e1dcd88a15d272512266c76R432) dated Sep 10, 2018 also by maflcko.
you can follow the conversation under the issue: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/27593

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -814,7 +814,7 @@ def _initialize_chain(self):
                     cache_node_dir,
                     chain=self.chain,
                     extra_conf=["bind=127.0.0.1"],
-                    extra_args=['-disablewallet'],
+                    extra_args=[],
comments.body: @maflcko `extra_args` parameter cannot be removed since it's a named parameter, unless the `TestNode.__init__(...)` signature is changed

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -807,14 +807,21 @@ def _initialize_chain(self):
         if not os.path.isdir(cache_node_dir):
             self.log.debug("Creating cache directory {}".format(cache_node_dir))
 
+            # Do not -disablewallet when in coverage mode to enable wallet RPCs to be checked
+            if self.options.coveragedir is not None:
+                extra_args = []
+                self.options.descriptors = True # since `None` will -disablewallet in TestNode(...)
comments.body: Why not add this to create_cache.py properly, like in all other wallet tests?

@@ -807,14 +807,17 @@ def _initialize_chain(self):
         if not os.path.isdir(cache_node_dir):
             self.log.debug("Creating cache directory {}".format(cache_node_dir))
 
+            # Do not -disablewallet when in coverage mode to enable wallet RPCs to be checked
+            extra_args = [] if self.options.coveragedir is not None else ['-disablewallet']
comments.body:
Is this needed? Why not:

```suggestion
            extra_args = []
```
nit: Could use f-string instead of `%` when touching this line?
